info.title: Superdocu API
info.description:
This API covers contacts management, requests creation and workflows details, in order to be able to manage requests within existing workflows.

You can retrieve all information about requests thanks to contact's workflows endpoints. With these ids you can fetch and updates data. It is not currently possible to destroy
requests and contacts' workflows.


This API follows [JSON API](https://jsonapi.org/) specification.

public_url.description:
Public URL of the file. This public URL and the file expire in 1 day
                      after the first generation. Check `expires_at` for the exact date.

checksum.description:
MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm by RSA Data
Security, Inc., described in RFC1321,
                      digest
of 128 bits (16 bytes)
                      

                      

This
value can be computed on a unix system with the following
command: `openssl md5 /path/to/file`
                      


                     

The system computes it with
`Digest::MD5.hexdigest` from ruby core lib.

You can filter thanks to filter[contact_tag] on contact tags IDs,
and on emails thanks to filter[email]

Tracking params, allowed keys: utm_source,
utm_campaign, utm_medium, utm_content, utm_term

post.description:
Sends an invitation email to contact with a link to his dashboard.
The contact has to have at least one request.

Create a request associated to a specific workflow.

This endpoint creates all documents associated to this workflow.

get.description: Get a request with documents groups
Get a checklist request with checks

put.description: Update a form request with answers values

checked.description: Value for the item. 1 = checked, 0 = unchecked

get.description:
Get a documents request with documents groups. The 200 responses
renders associated documents groups with their documents. Check the example
below.

form_input_id.description: Form Input ID for this answer

put.description: Update a form request with answers values

get.description:
Renders all workflows associated to a specific contact, with states
and modules ids/types to lookup data on them

Renders workflow associated to a specific contact, with states
and modules ids/types/basic data

You can filter thanks to filter[contact_tag] on contact tags IDs,
and on emails thanks to filter[email]
